name: Setlify Design System - Implementation Guide
description: Comprehensive implementation guide for AI assistants building features in the Setlify app. This document provides exact Tailwind classes, component patterns, and code examples to ensure visual consistency across the application.

cssVariables.description: These CSS variables are defined in src/index.css and referenced throughout the app via Tailwind semantic classes.

sans.value: 'Geist', 'Geist Fallback', ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', Arial, sans-serif

mono.value: 'Geist Mono', 'Geist Mono Fallback', ui-monospace, SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, monospace

sm.usage: Form labels, secondary text, table cells, button text (default)

lg.usage: Card titles, lead paragraphs, modal titles

spacing.description: Tailwind spacing scale. Use consistently for padding, margin, and gaps.

guidelines.buttonPadding: px-4 py-2 (default), px-3 for sm, px-8 for lg
guidelines.stackSpacing: space-y-1.5 (6px) for tight, space-y-4 (16px) for default

shadows.darkModeNotes: On dark backgrounds, shadows are less visible. Prefer border highlights and glassmorphism effects.

ariaPatterns.button: Use native <button> or asChild with Button
ariaPatterns.dialog: DialogTitle and DialogDescription are required for screen readers
ariaPatterns.dropdown: DropdownMenuTrigger should have aria-label if icon-only

doThis: Use semantic color classes (bg-primary, text-muted-foreground) not raw colors
Use the cn() utility for conditional classes
Use space-y-* or gap-* for consistent spacing
Wrap interactive elements in proper focus handling
Use variants and sizes from component props, not custom classes
Keep dark mode in mind - test both themes
avoidThis: Don't use arbitrary color values - use CSS variables
Don't create new components when existing ones work
Don't use inline styles - use Tailwind classes
Don't forget loading and error states
Don't use fixed pixel values - use the spacing scale
Don't override component internals - extend via className prop

codeExamples.confirmDialog:
```tsx
<Dialog>
  <DialogTrigger asChild>
    <Button variant="destructive">Delete</Button>
  </DialogTrigger>
  <DialogContent>
    <DialogHeader>
      <DialogTitle>Delete Song?</DialogTitle>
      <DialogDescription>
        This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete the song from your library.
      </DialogDescription>
    </DialogHeader>
    <DialogFooter>
      <DialogClose asChild>
        <Button variant="outline">Cancel</Button>
      </DialogClose>
      <Button variant="destructive" onClick={handleDelete}>Delete</Button>
    </DialogFooter>
  </DialogContent>
</Dialog>
```
